Board of Directors

Introduction

Dear Fellow Chamber Members,

Happy 2016!

I am very honored and humbled to have been afforded the opportunity to take on the role of Chairman of the Board of the Loudoun County Chamber of Commerce for 2015.

I am extremely proud of the Chamber’s larger accomplishments this year:

  • The Chamber’s Policy Committee, through its PolicyMaker Series and Loudoun BizVotes, successfully educated our members and many other Loudoun County residents, bringing clarity to the fog of campaign rhetoric.
  • Following a huge membership drive in 2014, a special emphasis on new member retention by our Membership Chairman, Mitch Sproul, has successfully kept our total membership value steady for the past two years.
  • In its first full year of existence, the Loudoun Chamber Foundation will make two series of grants to assist local nonprofits in their efforts that coincide with the Chamber’s Strategic Plan.

For the past few years, I have been working closely with our incoming 2016 Chairman, Greg Jay. He is a longtime resident and businessman in Loudoun County, and has become a good friend of mine. I am confident that the Chamber is now in great hands.

Thank you for all for Being a Part of It!, and thank you again for granting me the privilege of leading the Loudoun County Chamber of Commerce for the last year.

Sincerely,

Greg Jay
Chairman, 868 Estate Vineyards

Engage

Advocate

Community

Engage

Our mission at the Loudoun County Chamber of Commerce is to partner with our member businesses, nonprofit organizations and government partners, to create experiences and opportunities that produce personal, professional and community success. This means that we work to bring our community together to make a difference in the quality of life and business climate in Loudoun County.

422,223 times that our members were viewed in our online directory

53 ribbon cuttings performed for new businesses

1,700 leads successfully closed by LeadShare members

291 new members joined the Chamber

7,500+ members attended Chamber events

The Loudoun Chamber prides itself on working closely with its members of all sizes and industries to understand what issues matter most to them, and to ensure their voice is heard to help make Loudoun and Virginia as pro-business as possible.
Mindy Carlin, Access Point Public Affairs
HCA Virginia and StoneSprings Hospital Center find great value in the Loudoun Chamber. Its policy events are first rate and provide great access to decision makers, and the advocacy efforts on behalf of the business community are on point and highly effective.
Tracey White, StoneSprings Hospital Center
We expected the Chamber to provide an excellent opportunity for us to network with other Loudoun County businesses, which it has. We did not expect the Chamber to respond as quickly and effectively as it did when it learned that one of its members was being threatened. The Chamber hosted a rally at the brewery inviting residents and other local business owners to show their support. It was an amazing night and we are grateful for the ongoing support of the Chamber.
Chris Burns, Old Ox Brewery
The Loudoun Chamber prides itself on working closely with its members of all sizes and industries to understand what issues matter most to them, and to ensure their voice is heard to help make Loudoun and Virginia as pro-business as possible.
Mindy Carlin, Access Point Public Affairs

Tracey White, StoneSprings Hospital Center

We did not expect the Chamber to respond as quickly and effectively as it did when it learned that one of its members was being threatened. The Chamber hosted a rally at the brewery inviting residents and other local business owners to show their support. It was an amazing night and we are grateful for the ongoing support of the Chamber.
Chris Burns, Old Ox Brewery

Advocate

At the Loudoun Chamber, we have always been committed to being the “voice” of our members and our community, and 2015 was no exception. By providing unique events featuring state officials, local elected leaders, and even debates between candidates running for office, we strive to provide exclusive access to local policymakers that impact our day to day activities and shape the future of Loudoun for all of our members.

82% of the time Virginia House of Delegates and Senate supported the Chamber’s positions on legislation

Rural Economy Successfully fought for a new farm brewery ordinance to help stimulate the growth of Loudoun’s rural economy.

Business Friendly Fought for new County regulations to make it easier and more predictable to open and operate a business.

$1.3 Billion Economic Development is our top Policy position. Last year Loudoun secured more than $1.3 billion in economic investment, tops in Virginia

The Loudoun Chamber prides itself on working closely with its members of all sizes and industries to understand what issues matter most to them, and to ensure their voice is heard to help make Loudoun and Virginia as pro-business as possible.

Community

Being a part of such a strong & diverse community here in Loudoun County has made 2015 a fantastic year. From supporting small businesses through wellness and green campaigns, to gathering nonprofit organizations to collaborate, this year has had a focus on strengthening the relationships and the resources that impact our entire community.

422,223 times that our members were viewed in our online directory

53 ribbon cuttings performed for new businesses

1,700 leads successfully closed by LeadShare members

291 new members joined the Chamber

7,500+ members attended Chamber events

Awards

The Chamber‘s Signature Events allow us to recognize nearly 200 business leaders, first responders, and exceptional citizens through our various local awards. It‘s an honor to award these great community leaders, to share their stories and to inspire others.

422,223 times that our members were viewed in our online directory

53 ribbon cuttings performed for new businesses

1,700 leads successfully closed by LeadShare members

291 new members joined the Chamber

7,500+ members attended Chamber events
